title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 137.8 - De novo review
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 137.8 - De novo review

State Regulations
(a) A party aggrieved by the
arbitration award may commence an action on the merits of the fee dispute in a
court of competent jurisdiction within 30 days after the arbitration award has
been mailed. If no action is commenced within 30 days of the mailing of the
arbitration award, the award shall become final and binding. (b) Any party who fails to
participate in the hearing shall not be entitled to seek de novo review absent
good cause for such failure to participate. (c) Arbitrators shall not be called as
witnesses nor shall the arbitration award be admitted in evidence at the trial
de novo. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22
ยง
137.8

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
